Cell.Data: Anything between straight brackets - i.e. [ ] - is a formatting tag. Do not change these tags and keep them in the same relative position in the text. Anything between curly brackets - i.e. { } - is a place where text or numbers will be inserted by the game. Do not change the tag, but feel free to change its position in the text to suit the localized text.

In the text below, text refers to a person that can either be male or female. If relevant for translation, please use the ‘localized string’ column for the male text and the ‘alternative localized string’ column for the female text.

In the text below, any inserted strings - anything of the form {text} - is replaced by an integer value for the thing described in the brackets. If the {text} is not followed by a unit - e.g. shields, hitpoints - the icon for the unit is inserted together with the integer. The same holds for symbols - e.g. '+', '%' - which are occasionally inserted together with the integer.
For references to game terminology and in-world references, please check the glossary delivered as part of the documentation.
Unit gains [abilityblue]Phase Field[/abilityblue]. The unit is able to walk through obstacles and is {PhaseEvasion}% harder to hit in combat.
Discharges built up instability at a target.
Throw a Gravity Pulse Grenade dealing damage in a {hexrad} hex radius area.

The unit's attacks gain a {VoidAugmentChance}[strengthphysical/] strength chance ({VoidAugmentChanceRepeating}[strengthphysical/] for repeating attacks) to apply [abilityred]Dimensional Instability[/abilityred].[br/]If the attack already applies this status effect, instead increase its strength by +{VoidAugmentChanceRepeating}[strengthphysical/].
The unit's attacks gain a {StasisChance}[strengthphysical/] strength chance ({StasisChanceRepeating}[strengthphysical/] for repeating attacks) to remove {stasisremoveap} action point from the target.

Whenever the unit takes damage, its attacker is teleported {QuantumAvatarTeleport} hex away from their current position and has a {StasisChance}[strengthphysical/] strength chance to receive [abilityred]Dimensional Instability[/abilityred].[br/][br/]The unit and any Voidtech or Voidtech-modded units adjacent to it receive {QuantumAvatarShields}.
This Voidtech unit stands within a Quantum Avatar halo effect, gaining {QuantumAvatarShields}.
Is this supposed to be Stagger Resistance, like in the mod description?

Voidtech allows for the capability of creating limited echo copies of people that can perform actual tasks, increasing colony resource ouput.[br/][br/]All colonies' [Food/], [Energy/], [Production/] and [Research/] slots produce {ResourceIncome} of their respective resource per colonist working it.
Applies to Food, Knowledge, Production, Energy

Voidtech technology can be applied to sensors, boosting the range and allowing them to read the dimensional signature of entities.[br/][br/]Scout units and colonies get {ScoutSensorRange} sensor and vision range. Non-Scout units get {NonScoutSensorRange} sensor and vision range.

If we're generating energy in this dimension, surely another version of us is doing the same in a different dimension. If we could find a way to tap into that energy...[br/][br/]Colonies produce an extra {EnergyIncome}
By implementing quantum networking, research speed can be boosted tremendously.[br/][br/]{ResearchIncome} in each colony for every research sector linked to it.
This unit is considered a Voidtech Unit and is protected from offensive Voidtech Operations and abilities.
Forcefully attempt to teleport target unit to a hex adjacent to this unit with a strength {teleportchance} chance. A unit can only be targeted by this ability once per turn.
Target friendly unit is teleported to a hex adjacent to this unit, healing for {Evacuateheal} and gaining +{shieldgain} for {turnshield}
Powerful melee attack that [abilityred]knocks back[/abilityred] Light units.
{DimensionalInstabilityChance}[StrengthPhysical/] strength chance to cause [abilityred]Dimensional Instability[/abilityred] until the end of combat.
This unit is no longer solidly connected to this dimension. They lose one level of Stagger Resistance.
This unit is losing its grip on this dimension, reducing the damage its attacks deal by {PsionicDamageDecrease}%.
This unit's very existence is unstable. At the start of their turn, they randomly teleport up to {TeleportRange} hexes away from their original position.

The unit splits into alternate versions of itself. The clone unit teleports a short distance, leaving the original version behind. The clone lasts {turns}. If the original unit is killed while cloned, the clone will remain, replacing the original unit.

The unit splits into alternate versions of itself. The clone unit teleports a short distance, delivering a burst of instability, leaving the original version behind. The clone lasts {turns}. If the original unit is killed while cloned, the clone will remain, replacing the original unit.
This unit is a quantum clone. If the original unit is killed, this unit will replace it, becoming the original.
This unit can move through obstacles in tactical combat and is {PhaseFieldDef} harder to hit.

Has a strength {procChance} to apply [abilityred]Dimensional Desync[/abilityred] to the target unit for {dimensionaldesynctime}, making it immune to damage but unable to use abilities, on failure applies [abilityred]Dimensional Instability[/abilityred].[br/][br/]Always succeeds when targeting allies.
Unit is immune to damage, but cannot use abilities.
Cause a minor rift to manifest in a {hexrad} hex radius area, dealing damage and teleporting targets {DimensionalRiftHexes} hexes in a random direction.

Affects all units in a {TimeWarpRadius} hex radius area. Friendly units gain [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue], and enemy units are inflicted with [abilityred]Slow Movement[/abilityred] for {TimeWarpDuration}.

Target unit receives Reactive Phase Defense for {ReactivePhaseProtectionTime}. Each time the unit takes damage, it is teleported to a random hex within {ReactivePhaseProtectionRange} hexes of their original position.
Each time the unit takes damage, it is teleported to a random hex within {ReactivePhaseProtectionRange} hexes of their original position.

Drops a Vortex Charge in a {AoERadius} hex radius area, dealing {VorextChargeDamage} damage to all non-Voidtech units with a strength {VortexChargeChance} chance to inflict [abilityred]Dimensional Instability[/abilityred].

Create an Unstable Echo of target non-Hero unit. A copy of the unit appears adjacent to it and is under your control. Unstable Echos deal [abilityred]50%[/abilityred] less damage, but are otherwise indistinguishable from the original.[br/][br/]The Unstable Echo dissipates at end of combat.
This unit is but a shadow of its real self and inflicts [abilityred]{UnstableEchoDamagePen}[/abilityred] less damage.
Resurrect target friendly dead non-Flying, non-Hero unit with full [hp/].

Drop a Dimensional Vortex Bomb onto the target 1 hex radius area, dealing {DimVortexBombDamage}[damagephysical/] damage with Massive Impact. All non-Voidtech units in the area are randomly teleported to a position up to {DimVortexRange} hexes away from their original location.
Units in target army lose all of their [movewalk/] move points. In addition, all of the units in the targeted army have [abilityred]Very Slow Movement[/abilityred] for {TurnDuration}.
The temporal lock has successfully affected the target army, halting their advance dead in its tracks.
The temporal lock did not manage to displace local time, but it at least partially affected the target army.
The time and space around one of our armies has been distorted, halting their advance.
Our enemies tried to target one of our armies with a temporal time lock to halt their advance. Our army has been only partially affected.
Units in affected army lost all of their [movewalk/] move points for {Duration}[turn/].
On failure, units in the affected army have [abilityred]Very Slow Movement[/abilityred] for {TurnDuration}.
Teleport the target owned army to the capital colony and give all units in the army [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue] for {TurnDuration}.
The army was recalled to the capital colony and has [abilityblue]Fast Movement[/abilityblue] for {TurnCounter}.
This unit was recalled to the capital colony and has [abilityblue]Fast Movement.[/abilityblue]
The mass recall beacon has functioned exactly as intended, returning the targeted army to the capital colony.

A Void Storm hazard is spawned in the target sector, reducing [energy/] income by {IncomeReduction} and happiness by {HappinessReduction} in affected colonies. The Void Storm also has a chance to apply [abilityred]Dimensional Instability[/abilityred] to all units in the sector every {TurnChance} in tactical combat.[br/][br/]In addition, all non-Voidtech units in the sector take damage equal to {PercentageDamageCurrentHP} of their current [hp/][br/][br/]On failure, the Void Storm does not spawn, but damage is still dealt to units.
The Void Storm successfully formed in a violent explosion in the target location. Enemy non-Voidtech units in the sector suffered significant damage.
The Void Storm failed to anchor in this dimension, but still damaged enemy units in the sector.
A Void Storm hazard spawned in your sector, dealing damage to the armies present in the sector.
A Void Storm failed to anchor in your sector, but not without damaging the armies there.
Units suffered {PercentageDamageCurrentHP} damage of their current [hp/]
Encompass the world in Dimensional Rifts, drawing energy from them.
Non-Voidtech units have {TeleportChance} strength chance to be randomly teleported up to {teleportDistance} hexes away each [turn/] in combat.
{TeleportChance} strength chance to randomly teleport units not owned by a Voidtech player up to 2 hexes away at the start of each combat turn.
Tear space-time at target non-Voidtech enemy colony, creating a Dimensional Rift for {duration}. This effect increases in strength as you build more Dimensional Amplifier Tower.
The rift generators have fired successfully, and a rift has been torn open around the target colony. Already we are beginning to extract energy from the rift for use in our empire.
Enemy defensive systems have interfered with the function of our rift generators, causing them to fail. As the rift collapsed, shockwaves blasted through the colony, causing panic in the streets.
The enemy has torn open some sort of dimensional rift over one of our colony. The rift is interfering with local infrastructure and power systems, causing chaos.

The enemy has attempted to tear open some sort of dimensional rift over one of our colonies, but was thwarted by our defensive systems. The aftermath of the attack caused some minor damage though, which has led to rioting and panic among the populace.

The Dimensional Amplifier Tower unlocks the Dimensional Rift Doomsday Weapon. Each additional Dimensional Amplifier Tower you build increases the level of the weapon, making it stronger.[br/][br/]Only one Dimensional Amplifier Tower may be built per colony.
The final step in the Voidtech plan opens Dimensional Rifts throughout various worlds, drawing a near infinite amount of energy from them.[br/][br/]Requires Instability Rift level 3.[br/]

After years of arduous research and endless experiments, the moment is finally upon us. Just as our calculations predicted, the cascade has flooded across the planet, opening rift after rift. Once the process is complete, we will have access to power without limit!

Collapse reality around the target, with a {InstaKillChance} strength chance to instantly killing them without leaving a corpse. If this fails, deal {DimensionalCollapseDamage} damage and [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred] instead.[br/][br/]Cannot target Commander units.

Prepare Phase Echoes in the target friendly colony. These will spawn during any combat that takes place within the colony's domain. At the start of combat, this will create Unstable Echoes of {PhaseEchoGuardNumber} random friendly units. The Echoes remain until end of combat.
The Phase Echo Guards have been prepared and are ready to be deployed into combat.
The defender has deployed Unstable Echoes into this battle.

Units in target army gain [abilityred]Destabilized[/abilityred] for {TurnDuration}, reducing damage resistance by {LoweredResistance} and decreasing morale by {LoweredMorale}.[br/][br/]If resisted, they are [abilityred]Demoralized[/abilityred] instead, reducing their morale by {LoweredMorale}.
The unit suffers from {LoweredResistance} on all resistance channels and {LoweredMorale}.
Our localized Void technology has successfully destabilized our enemies.
Our localized Void rift collapsed almost immediately. The sight of the Void only demoralized our enemies.
Our enemies have opened a local Void rift, destabilizing our troops.
Our enemies tried opening a local Void rift, but it collapsed quickly. The sight of the Void, however, demoralized our troops.
Target army has [abilityred]Destabilized[/abilityred] for {TurnDuration}, reducing their damage resistance by {LoweredResistance} and their morale by {LoweredMorale}
Target army is [abilityred]Demoralized[/abilityred] for {TurnDuration}, reducing their morale by {LoweredMorale}

Enemy units within the affected friendly colony domain have to use {ExtraMovePoints} extra move points for every hex they move and every {delay} have a {StrChanceSlow} strength chance to gain [abilityred]Slow[/abilityred], for {Duration}[turn/] when fighting in this domain.
We succesfully put up Void Barriers around the colony which will slow down any unwelcome visitors.
Every {delay} all enemy units have a {StrChanceSlow} strength chance to gain [abilityred]Slow[/abilityred], for {Duration}[turn/].
One of our Dimensional Amplifier Towers has been captured!
You have lost a Dimensional Amplifcation Tower!
{STR_Player} has lost a Dimensional Amplification Tower!
You have lost a Dimensional Amplification Tower. Our attempt at unleashing the Dimensional Cascade has been canceled!
{STR_Player} has lost a Dimensional Amplification Tower. Their attempt at unleashing the Dimensional Cascade has been foiled!
A player has unleashed their Dimensional Cascade!

By building a Dimensional Amplification Tower, {playerName} now has access to their Doomsday Weapon, the Dimensional Cascade. It is weak now, but will become more powerful as more Dimensional Amplification Towers are constructed.

By building a second Dimensional Amplification Tower, {playerName} has strengthened their Doomsday Weapon, the Dimensional Cascade. You should plan raids to destroy these structures before they become too powerful.

By building their final Dimensional Amplification Tower, {playerName} has maximized the strength of their Doomsday Weapon, the Dimensional Cascade. They are now close to fully unleashing it and winning the game. The time to strike is now!
The Doomsday Timer has been paused! You must reclaim the lost Dimensional Amplification Tower or you will lose your chance at unleashing the Dimensional Cascade upon your enemies!
The loss of a Dimensional Amplification Tower has canceled the Dimensional Cascade, ending the Doomsday Timer.
The loss of a Dimensional Amplification Tower has weakened our Dimensional Cascade, and your Doomsday operations have been canceled.

Our enemies have activated their Doomsday Weapon, a Dimensional Cascade has spread across the planet, and your own Doomsday Weapon has been wiped out by the cataclysm. You have {numTurns} to destroy one of their Dimensional Amplification Towers or they will win the game.
The Dimensional Cascade is active, and you will win in {numTurns} unless you lose one of your Dimensional Amplification Towers.
The Dimensional Cascade is active, and {playerName} will win in {numTurns} unless you can destroy one of their Dimensional Amplification Towers.
A Dimensional Amplification Tower has been captured! If it is destroyed, our Doomsday timer will be canceled. If you recapture the tower, then you will be able to resume the countdown.
A Dimensional Amplification Tower has been captured! If it is destroyed, the Doomsday timer will be canceled. If {playerName} recaptures the tower, then they will be able to resume the countdown.

{playerName} is priming their Dimensional Cascade Doomsday Weapon! If they are allowed to finish, your own Doomsday Weapon will be wiped out, and {playerName} will be but one step away from total victory!

You are the ruler of this world… at least in this dimension.[br/]There are infinite dimensions in which you are not.[br/]You enjoy your victory, but the costs of your actions[br/]reverberate across the multiverse.[br/]Each action triggers some form of reaction,[br/]even in quantum physics.
